Message.Title: Massachusetts Sales Tax
Message.Msg: Amazon should not have agreed with the lovely pols of Boston to collect a sales tax for goods sold in the Commonwealth. It is my understanding that Amazon has some very insignificant "presence" in this Commonwealth and therefor was liable for doing so. What it should have done was everything in the world possible to keep its sales TAX FREE. It should have and could have easily eliminated its "presence" and there would have been nothing Massachusetts could have to force the issue. Everybody should be aware that the collection of Internet sales taxes involves highly important and critical constitutional issues of federalism with each and every state being a separate co equal sovereign. As a practical matter, most MA residents will just head north for major purchases in the Granite State---New Hampshire. NO SALES TAX. PMM
This continues to move higher - NVAX the stock that makes you money.
